gameplay

Class EnemyTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.EnemyTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EnemyTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    The EnemyTracker class stores the required information about a given enemy. It is the foundation of the Enemy logic.

    Author:
    Chady Kamar, Leonardo Siracusa
    See Also:
    Enemy, Serialized Form

      EnemyTracker(int positionX, int positionY, Tile enemyType)
      Creates an enemy tracker which stores the position and direction of one enemy.

        public EnemyTracker(int positionX,
                    int positionY,
                    Tile enemyType)
        Creates an enemy tracker which stores the position and direction of one enemy.
        Parameters:
        positionX - Enemy's initial position in x.
        positionY - Enemy's initial position in y.
        enemyType - Enemy's type.
